newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk Islamist firebrand MP faces incitement charge.
newsitem.headline: Turk Islamist firebrand MP faces incitement charge.

text.p: Turkey's secularist government has asked deputies to lift parliamentary immunity of an Islamist MP so he can be charged over fiery speeches he made, Anatolian news agency said on Monday.

It said the justice ministry had sent a document to the parliament speaker's office requesting that MP Sevki Yilmaz lose his immunity for "inciting the people to break the law" in a series of public addresses.

Yilmaz resigned from the Islam-based Welfare Party last month after Turkish television channels showed videos of him apparently insulting fellow MPs and criticising Turkey's secular system at public meetings.
Yilmaz says the tapes, some of which date back to the early 1990s, were tampered with to alter his remarks.

Turkey's secularist establishment has started a series of legal probes into members of the previous Islamist-led government since former prime minister Necmettin Erbakan resigned last month under pressure from the secularist army.
